p: There is growing interest in the advancement of collaborative and co-creative projects which involve more responsibility on the part of the citizen scientists who are involved. In fact, a recent study conducted across 125 European-based projects found the roles citizen scientists undertook in the projects were predominantly those of collaborators (Moczek et al., 2021). Such approaches are increasingly chosen when attention is required from both local actors and communities in order to solve place-based problems and deliver community outcomes (Gunnell et al., 2021; Manzoni et al., 2021).
